Posts.Content: The MRI that I had required an IV. This involves a slight pinching , but not bad at all. If your mom is super sensitive to pain, she can get a perscription for lanocaine (sp?) ointment and apply this prior to the procedure. Another woman having MRI at same time, had taken a sedative, Atavan, prior to her MRI because she was concerned about the confinement of the machine. She didn't care what they did!! I am not familiar with PET scan.
Posts.Title: Pet Scan and Mri, Any Precautions For Pain???

Posts.Content: Wondering how you are doing? You last wrote that you were going to plastic surgeon. Thoughts and my prayers are with you.
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: I am scheduled for these injections to locate the sentinel node, prior to my lumpectomy. I am more afraid of these injections than the surgery itself. I have read that they are very painful. Doctor said he could give me a valium, will this help?
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Sandy and Becky, thank you so much for your replies. I cannot believe how the stress of this test has taken over my every thought. I seem more concerned about this than what is to come during the next day surgery. Sandy, I called my doctor and told him about the lidocaine and he thought it was a good idea. Is it a perscription ointment? And as you said Becky, he told me the lidacaine shot would not really help and was just as uncomfortable. I think he said I would get four shots of this dye. I hope they are quick...How long did this process take? thanks again for your help.
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: I survived the sentinel node test, and thanks to all of your support, it was not bad at all. The atavan and lidocain cream certainly helped. Needle pricks were short and did not even feel any burning. Was surprised that the doctor doing the injections said he had never seen anyone with this cream! Surgery is over and looking forward to the next step in this journey.
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Wondering how you are doing? You last wrote that you were going to plastic surgeon. Thoughts and my prayers are with you.
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: I was in a lot of pain also. Part of it is the nerves regenerating themselves and after my surgery the area filled with fluid. My doctor aspirated it and I felt instant relief. If the area is swollen, this might be something for you to look into having done.
Posts.Title: While im Waiting For my Results

Posts.Content: Ruth, I just read your message that you posted in July. Wondering if you decided to have chemo? I am meeting with my oncologist next week and I have a strong feeling he will be advising chemo. My lump was also small but Er positive and Her2 neg. How did you make out with radiation? Best wishes to you.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed..so Now What...
